thread.title: Hunter puts frozen fox on show to warn of dangers of the chilly Danube
thread.title_full: Hunter puts frozen fox on show to warn of dangers of the chilly Danube

author: Our Foreign Staff
title: Hunter puts frozen fox on show to warn of dangers of the chilly Danube
text:
News Hunter puts frozen fox on show to warn of dangers of the chilly Danube A block of ice containing a drowned fox who broke through the thin ice of the Danube Credit: Johannes Stehle/AP Our Foreign Staff 13 January 2017 â€¢ 10:54pm 
A hunter in Germany has put on show a block of ice containing a fox that he says fell into the chilly Danube and drowned, in what he calls a warning of the dangers of the icy river. 
Franz Stehle, 61, has told news agency dpa that the block containing the fox was extracted from the ice on Jan. 2 and put on display outside his family's hotel in Fridingen. The town is on the upper reaches of the Danube , close to its source in southwestern Germany. Watch | 'Ice jams' form on the Danube in Hungary 00:39 
M r Stehle told Das Bild he discovered the animal in December while walking along the riverbank close to his house. 
"I went back with a chainsaw in January to take him out," he said. 
"I wanted to put him on show to make sure nobody goes onto the ice. People should have respect for nature." 
He added that it was not unusual for animals to break through the frozen surface of the river in winter. He says he's seen a frozen deer and wild boar before. 
Elsewhere a 43 year old woman was killed in front of her children when she was crushed by a tree which had been uprooted by heavy winds near Nice in Southern France.
